name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
November:

The Director of the Smithsonian American History Museum agreed to my request that the NMI flag & the flags of Am. Samoa, Guam & the US Virgin Islands be added to the display of flags surrounding the Museum. They raise the new insular area flags June 14, 2022, Flag Day. https://t.co/QMYGdzXjDS

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
October:

Because of the $30m we included in the Rescue Plan for Marianas food aid, about 2K more families became eligible for the Commonwealth’s Nutritional Assistance Program & benefits increased 23%. This is higher than in the contiguous 48 states, DC & the US Virgin Islands. https://t.co/xaq5ZfJzzK

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
September:

Based on legislation we passed in 2019, the Biden HHS Dept., has decided that federal Medicaid funding for the Marianas will be $64m in FY22. Under the previous administration funding was expected to drop to about $6 million. https://t.co/j056yrYMbi

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
August:

The NMI’s plan for distributing the increased child tax credit included in the Rescue Plan was passed. The Rescue Plan increased the credit to $3,600 per child under age 6 & $3K for ages 6-17. By November Marianas families had received $28,726,000. https://t.co/opyBWUd3lG

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
July:

As the House readied the FY22 spending bills, I successfully added language to the Homeland Security appropriation to forgive the $93,734,930 the Commonwealth borrowed from the federal government through the Community Disaster Loan program this year. https://t.co/8p1LD16uRX

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
June: 

I intro'd legislation creating a VA Advisory Committee for the US Outlying Areas & FAS. Composed of vets from the 5 territories, the FSM, RMI, & Palau, the committee would advise the Vets Secretary on how to improve benefits & services for vets in the insular areas. https://t.co/sBeSpwPUyR

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
May:

My request for insular area Medicaid improvement to be part of Pres. Biden’s 1st budget was successful. The Pres.’ FY22 budget proposed eliminating Medicaid funding caps for the territories & aligning the matching rate with the States. https://t.co/KFgTIA8KRI

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
April:

On Earth Day, I reintro'd the Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act, H.R. 2811, which bans the possession and sale of shark fins in the US. A majority of House members, 237, from both sides of the aisle signed on as cosponsors. https://t.co/I4gDzAm9YU

name: Del. Kilili Sablan

https://t.co/eu4VvNUDnR https://t.co/Xaz0ma67JA

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: We all know what to do. And, if we follow those rules, we can flatten the curve, avoid the worst-case scenario, save lives, and eventually begin returning to normal.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: That should get you past the error message concerning street addresses in the .@fema application process.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
You will get an error page, but it's okay. There will be a "Corrected Address" and a "Submitted Address."

DO NOT CLICK "RESUBMIT" under "Corrected Address"

Rather, click "Use Submitted" under "Submitted Address" https://t.co/3mAAmU7O3T

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
When you start applying online at https://t.co/uPJZ2QiI0g, you will eventually get to the page where they ask about your street address. Here, you will enter:

LOT + # + street name spelled out + village name.

It is not case sensitive; all text entered is all caps. https://t.co/IlIGOK02wY

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: First, you must find your Lot Number. You can go to https://t.co/ORW9uSqbVl to find your lot number. Your lot number, village, and street name are what are important to retrieve here.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Many still have questions about how to enter their address when applying at https://t.co/uPJZ2QiI0g. .@FEMA requires a street address, but we have a system of lot numbers in the Marianas. So we'd like to walk you through the process in this thread.

Safety & Security: Lodging identified for 300-400 emergency responders. Government offices, schools closed until further notice.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Hazardous Waste
-Solid Waste facility in Puerto Rico, Saipan open for disposal of green waste, metals, and white goods.
-As Gonno facility expected by Saturday, 10/27
-Marpi transfer station will reopen as soon as debris is removed.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Airports: 
-Saipan: significant damage; restricted to flights providing humanitarian assistance; Commercial outbound flights expected to begin Sunday, 10/28.
-Tinian: open; flights scheduled to resume on Saturday, 10/27.
-Rota: open

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Transportation
Ports: Ports in Saipan and Tinian remain closed; Rota ports open. 
Roads: Many areas inaccessible due to debris

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Communication 
-Significant damage to cell towers throughout the islands; cell reception and internet connectivity intermittent.
-CNMI Public Safety Radio System is online.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Energy
-Power outage continues; 18,700 on Saipan, 1,120 on Tinian, & 1,050 on Rota affected. 
-Saipan: 9 feeders down; U.S. ACE working w/CUC to restore power; island relying on generators.
-Tinian: 4 power feeders down; island relying on generators.
-Rota: all feeders online.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
-Tinian: Health Center is operational & on generator power.
-Saipan: Dialysis center resumed operations; U.S. Health & Human Services Disaster Medical Assistance Team providing support; hospital on generator power.
- Rota Health Center is on generator power; no damage reported.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Health & Medical
-Public Health Emergency declared to release medical resources.
-VA Pharmacy Disaster Relief Plan active. 
-Community Guidance Center will be offering counseling services at the wellness center.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Water: Saipan water service restoration timeline unknown.
Shelters are open on each island: 
-Saipan: 12 shelters available; 6 at capacity; local officials seeking additional spaces; 893 occupants
-Tinian: 2 shelters; 34 occupants
-Rota: 2 shelters; 79 occupants

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:

-Schools are closed until further notice.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
SITUATIONAL UPDATE for #SuperTyphoonYutu (a thread) 
10/25/2018 (EDT)

Safety & Security
- Government offices closed until further notice
- Schools closed until further notice
- Tinian: Rescue efforts ongoing

#TyphoonYutu #Yutu #Marianas

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: @wxnewsdesk I apologize for not seeing this sooner. Follow back to DM us about a possible interview, please?

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Click to read the first Recovery Update from the Governor's office regarding updates on hospitals, schools, utilities and various relief efforts:

https://t.co/Omjt6ZVQZe

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: The process by which the Governor determines whether to request a Disaster Declaration is currently underway. However, until/unless such a Declaration is requested  issued, residents impacted by Yutu should not yet apply for disaster assistance pertaining to Yutu-related damages.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: The President has previously issued an Emergency Declaration, allowing FEMA and other Federal agencies to provide the support listed above.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: - FEMA is bringing additional staff to coordinate air operations with the US Dept. of Defense and others supporting response and recovery operations throughout CNMI.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: - The CNMI Public Safety Radio System is offline; CNMI & FEMA Operations have established a Communications Task Force to address this and other communication issues.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
- Saipan’s hospital and Rota’s medical clinic are open and operating and have beds available.

- CUC is working with the US Army Corps of Engineers on permanent power restoration

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
- US Health & Human Services Disaster Medical Assistance Team is on the way to CNMI to support medical facilities, as needed.

-Although the hospital on Tinian incurred structural damage, no patients were inside at the time

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Updates from CNMI, FEMA and the Federal family of agencies on the ground working on recovery: 

- FEMA and the US Dept. of Defense are supporting a request from CNMI, on behalf of Tinian, for food and water.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: RT @RepJenniffer: My thoughts and prayers with the people of Northern Marianas as they face the super typhoon #yutu  🙏🏻@Kilili_Sablan https…

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: @fema urges #Yutu survivors to begin cleaning and making repairs. No need to wait for an inspector to come to your home. During cleanup, be sure to: 1) report losses to your insurance agent; 2) take photos/videos of the damage; 3) save receipts for disaster-related expenses

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: More media coverage of the destruction caused by #SuperTyphoonYutu. We will keep you informed as we begin our long road to recovery. Stay strong, Marianas!  https://t.co/sn9qER18Kh

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Disaster recovery centers that were opened in response to Typhoon Mangkhut will remain closed Friday 10/26. @FEMA is assessing whether to reopen or relocate the DRCs #SuperTyphoonYutu

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: All CNMI government offices will remain closed until further notice due to #SuperTyphoonYutu.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
The Typhoon Warning for Saipan and Tinian has been CANCELLED.

The Tropical Storm Warning for Alamagan, Pagan and Agrihan has been CANCELLED.

#SuperTyphoonYutu #TyphoonYutu #Yutu #Marianas #CNMI

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
.@fema was asked to bring in commodities to support ongoing shelter operations and it appears they will arrive tomorrow.

#SuperTyphoonYutu #TyphoonYutu #Yutu #Marianas #CNMI

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
The Governor’s team is working to open additional shelters as most of the existing shelters are either at capacity or sustained damage which prevents them from taking in more residents.

#SuperTyphoonYutu #TyphoonYutu #Yutu #Marianas #CNMI

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
"We're surviving, we'll get through this — we are a resilient people — but it's just huge."

https://t.co/w3h7koBQpp

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: https://t.co/t8iuyijVnk

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: https://t.co/FuoYQSzeBG

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Per .@fema, tarps are something that may be provided by CNMI Red Cross, and/or other agencies, however bulk distribution or a tarping mission would likely not begin until life-saving, life-sustaining needs have been met.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Per .@fema , the priority when it comes to roadway debris clearance will be emergency routes utilized by first responder personnel.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
#SuperTyphoonYutu is moving away from the Marianas. Typhoon warning is cancelled for Rota, but still in effect for Saipan & Tinian. Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect for Alamagan, Pagan & Agrihan.

Closest point of contact to us is Tinian @ 155 miles WNW.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: RT @ahofschneider: Here are some photos and videos of the Northern Mariana Islands in the wake of #TyphoonYutu: https://t.co/Y4BF000fVY

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: @Jo_Barnes

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
I had a conversation with .@FEMA prepositioned staff this morning. They will make assessments & try to get the airport & seaport opened so emergency supplies could be brought in.

#SuperTyphoonYutu #Yutu #TyphoonYutu #Marianas

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: RT @kevin_ahern: Most mainland Americans don’t know that the Northern Mariana Islands are part of their country and don’t know that it’s be…

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: I want to thank my colleague .@NancyPelosi for her call & @WhipHoyer,@RobBishopUT, @lisamurkowski,@RepHuffman, @RepRoybalAllard,@repjohnlewis, @BennieGThompson,@RepMikeQuigley, who’ve all reached out. They’ve informed me they’re ready to help the Marianas w/ whatever’s needed.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu The Emergency Operations Center is having phone connectivity issues. Calls may not be getting through at this time. I will continue to provide information as it becomes available.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu The emergency shelter on Tinian is full. Officials are assessing backup shelters to ensure safe conditions. PSS is conducting an assessment to determine which Saipan shelters can take more people.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu anyone experiencing a medical emergency should go to the nearest fire station. If you are on Saipan or Rota, you can go to the hospital/clinic if it is closer. The Tinian clinic is closed due to extensive damage.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu Destructive winds are anticipated through noon today. Please remain indoors unless a life-threatening situation requires you to leave your homes.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu A reminder for everyone in the Marianas to please remain indoors and stay away from windows. Although the worst of the typhoon has passed, it is still not safe for anyone to go outside.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu All ports are closed. Over 20 flights into the Northern Marianas have been cancelled. The Commonwealth Office of Transit Authority has temporarily ceased emergency evacuation transport services to Saipan shelters for safety reasons.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu The Tinian Medical Center sustained extensive damage. Fortunately no patients were present. CHC and Rota Medical Center are running on generator power.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: #SuperTyphoonYutu 13 shelters are open with one more location on standby. Saipan has 10 shelters open; six are full. Tinian has one shelter; Rota has two. FEMA has 10 days of food and water on hand for those in need. Cots, blankets, tents, toilet kits, and tarps also available.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Nearly 200 FEMA and other federal agency personnel are in the Marianas ready to assist CNMI in typhoon recovery. #SuperTyphoonYutu

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
FEMA wants to remind us to not venture outside until told that it is safe to do so by local officials.

In the current weather conditions, it isn’t safe. If you must leave your home due to a life-threatening situation, your best option is to go to your closest fire station.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
As of 8pm, the storm's closest to Saipan, at about 85 miles southeast of the island and about 90 miles southeast of Tinian.

Maximum sustained winds of 165 mph. The storm is moving north-northwest at 12mph.

Stay safe, Marianas.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
Typhoon Condition 1 remains in effect for Saipan, Tinian and Rota. Tropical Storm Condition 1 is in effect for Alamagan, Pagan and Agrihan.

Typhoon conditions expected to persist through the evening into late Thursday morning.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Post offices on Saipan and Rota will be closed during Super Typhoon Yutu and will remain closed until further notice.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text:
YUTU UPGRADED TO SUPER TYPHOON

Typhoon warnings remain in effect for Rota, Tinian & Saipan. A Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect for Guam

Typhoon conditions are expected tonight through late Thursday morning at Rota, Tinian & Saipan. https://t.co/8pAcMXsqPC

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: Gov. Torres is asking for an emergency declaration due to Typhoon Yutu starting October 24, 2018 & Direct Federal assistance is needed for Rota, Tinian, Saipan, Agrihan, Pagan, & Alamagan to include DOD strategic airlift, mass care & sheltering commodities, and generators.

name: Del. Kilili Sablan
tweet_text: In anticipation of Tropical Storm Yutu’s approach, FEMA announced that disaster recovery centers in the Marianas will be closed Wed 10/24 and Thu 10/25. FEMA will assess the reopening of the DRCs after the storm passes.
